alert.note: Alert for Greenwood (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 8:24PM EDT until June 26 at 11:16AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. High flows are ongoing along Wilson Creek with isolated lowland flooding possible. * WHERE...Greenwood County, South Carolina * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, golf courses, secondary roadways, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood-prone, low-water crossings may become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 807 PM EDT, A line of showers and storms is currently moving through Greenwood County and is producing a brief period of moderate to heavy rainfall, especially across the eastern third of the county. This is producing a quick 0.50-1.50 inches of rainfall on top of 2-5" of rain which has fallen since Wednesday evening. These heavier showers and storms will move north of the county by 10 PM and only light rain is expected thereafter. However, continued high stream levels will persist into the late evening hours and it will take a while longer for areas of lowland flooding to improve across the county. Therefore the Flood Advisory will continue to allow streams to recede below critical levels. - Additional rounds of showers and thunderstorms are expected to develop on Thursday. These showers and storms will be very efficient at producing heavy rainfall. Soils are saturated and streams are swollen. Therefore, additional heavy rain may quickly create new areas of flooding and cause previous areas of flooding to redevelop. As a result, Flash Flood Warnings may be issued during the day on Thursday. Caution is advised near any stream or other vulnerable area. Seek higher ground immediately if heavy rain develops. Please have a plan in place should flash flooding develop and do not hesitate to act. - Some locations that may experience flooding include...Greenwood, Ninety Six, Cokesbury, Troy, Ninety Six Historic Site, Greenwood State Park, Promised Land, Bradley, Coronaca, Epworth, Kirksey, Callison and Dyson.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Obey all barricades, even if no water is over the roadway. Barricaded roads may have been compromised by earlier high flows and flooding and may not be safe for travel.
